Articles.Content:
HELP!!! Ever since 1.2 came out

I couldn't play the game because there are mods that i cant live without

SO is there anyway i could update these mods manually?
It would be good to know what mods you had in mind...

Very broadly speaking, mods fall into two categories:

1.) Config mods, which use only the game mechanics that Squad has included in KSP. The most common type of config mod is a collection of new parts. These are very easy to update; often they don't even need any changes, and will just work across a KSP version update. But not always. You'll need a sharp eye for the finer details of the KSP patch notes to judge if changes are necessary or not.
2.) Plugin mods, which extend the functionality of KSP. A typical plugin mod would be Kopernicus, or Ferram Aerospace Research. The difficulty of porting them to a new version ranges from 'just needs a recompile' all the way to 'needs to be rewritten from scratch'. The more complex the mod is, the more it will lean towards the latter end of the spectrum.

Edited November 29, 2016 by Streetwind
That is why you shouldn't update your game until all your mods are compatible.

2 hours ago, KSK said:

It would be good to know what mods you had in mind...

 

Hello KSK!!! Sorry for responding so late because i was busy with my family going to a mall trip!!! Anyway i will show all the mods i have in this one picture below

Note: THIS AN OLD PICTURE BEFORE THE UPDATE

Quite a few of those have already been updated.  KER is going to take awhile, since it has to account for the new in-game fuel-flow mechanic, among other things.

Best thing to do is move your good install elsewhere on your computer and play it while waiting for the updates to the mods that AREN'T updated yet.

The other best thing to do is be patient.  The mod devs are working as hard as they can to get their mod compatible with the new game, and asking them, "Is it ready yet?" will most likely make them take longer.
KER has a development version that works pretty well.

2 hours ago, Red Iron Crown said:

KER has a development version that works pretty well.

Yes, but it IS a dev version, and as such, anyone using it should expect some things might not work.

 I'm using it myself without any issues yet, but that may not last.

43 minutes ago, MaxxQ said:

Yes, but it IS a dev version, and as such, anyone using it should expect some things might not work.

 I'm using it myself without any issues yet, but that may not last.

so how much do i wait until the devs finish with their mods?

Thank you in advance

Best thing to do is move your good install elsewhere on your computer and play it while waiting for the updates to the mods that AREN'T updated yet.

3 minutes ago, How to: KSP said:

so how much do i wait until the devs finish with their mods?

Thank you in advance

 

 

You can always subscribe/follow the release thread here in the forums. A good deal of modders use it as their primary PR platform, so-to-speak. When there is an update, you will receive a notification. If your settings are configured to, you will even receive an email when the thread is updated. 

Patience is virtue.

K than I shall subscribe to their forums

9 minutes ago, How to: KSP said:

so how much do i wait until the devs finish with their mods?

Thank you in advance

 

 

Basically, you wait until they're done.  Or learn to play without the ones that aren't updated yet.  I JUST started playing KSP 1.2.1 last week, after most of my go-to mods had finally been updated or have dev versions available.  In the meantime, I played quite a bit of Civilization 3 (never got the hang of it before, and it's just been languishing in my steam folder for the past three years), after my housemate showed me how to play.  Actually, before I started last week, I hadn't played since the 1.2 update came out.  There was some Witcher 3 in there as well.

The thing is, KSP has had this kind of a development cycle since it was first released.  Squad are always updating and patching the game, and most of us who've been around for awhile expect it to break mods and saves.  I'm guessing you're a fairly new player, and so aren't used to this.  As DrunkenKerbonaut said, patience is a virtue.  Just keep monitoring the mod release threads, and eventually, they'll be updated.  Whatever you do, don't ask in the thread when it'll be done.  It's not only rude, but also against forum rules.

well i respect your speech and think that you are correct!!!

Time to play plague inc XD

BTW i completed all the standard viruses in mega brutal

1 hour ago, How to: KSP said:

so how much do i wait until the devs finish with their mods?

Thank you in advance

 

Sometime between right now & never.

3 hours ago, How to: KSP said:

so how much do i wait until the devs finish with their mods?

As long as it takes. 

(It varies tremendously, depending on, first, how much work the author has to do for the update to happen, and, second, how much time/inclination the author has to work on it.  Remember that these people have jobs, families, school, etc., and aren't getting paid for this.  It's just a hobby.)

The best thing to do is to just subscribe to their release threads, as MaxxQ said.

MaxxQ also provided some excellent advice, here:

8 hours ago, MaxxQ said:

The other best thing to do is be patient.  The mod devs are working as hard as they can to get their mod compatible with the new game, and asking them, "Is it ready yet?" will most likely make them take longer.

...not only may it make them take longer, it may discourage them from updating at all, or from producing additional cool mods in the future.  Bear in mind that lots of people are eager for mods, and "when will it be ready?" gets asked a lot.  Generally the people who ask this are well-meaning... but they don't realize that this kind of question tends to be unpleasant "pressuring" for the mod author, no matter how politely worded.

It's such a nuisance that not only is asking for an update considered poor etiquette, it's actually against forum rules (at least, if someone has already asked)-- we had to put a rule in place about it, because mod authors were getting hounded so much it made life unpleasant for them.  Discussion here:

...so, please, don't ask for updates.  Just be patient, subscribe to the mod's thread, and wait for an update to arrive, which might be tomorrow, or next week, or a year, or never.

...so, please, don't ask for updates.  Just be patient, subscribe to the mod's thread, and wait for an update to arrive, which might be tomorrow, or next week, or a year, or never.

I thank you for actually writing a speech for me!!!

That's the first time anyone wrote me a speech.

But in all seriousness u r right and ik that i shall restrain myself from asking these people that work on these mods.

Scincerly, HowToKSP
